intro: Holostigma dioicum, commonly known as the yellow buttercup, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its showy, yellow flowers with five petals. The plant has palmately divided leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Holostigma dioicum is an herbaceous perennial that produces small, green fruits containing seeds.
